intro: Euphrasia conillii, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and woodlands. Euphrasia conillii is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Its botanical features make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
